question: Although you have never formally studied computing, you have always been interested in computers. You have just read about a computer course that really interests you, but it is only for people who have completed an elementary course.Write a letter to the college enrolment officer. In your letterexplain why you are writingdescribe your circumstancesask if a special exception can be made for you so you can enrol in the courseYou do NOT need to write any addresses.
text: I am writing this letter to request you for a special consideration towards enrolling me into the Advanced Computing course that is scheduled for next month at your college.

I am professionally working as a Software Developer for a consultant firm in New Delhi and have a bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering from one of the top tier colleges in North India. I have read the eligibility criteria for admission into the aforementioned course on your website, and I am eager to join it. While the relevance of my qualification does not meet those requirements, but I want to mention that I have covered and used a wide range of elementary concepts of computing such as linear arithmetic and non-linear progressions during my two years of job as a software developer since it involves an immense amount of complex calculations for building various computer applications.

In view of my practical usage of the basic concepts of mathematical computation, which I strongly believe will be sufficient for the course, along with my passion for this field, I request you to review my application with special consideration to let me participate in this academic course.
I will be looking forward to your reply.
